title: ComboBox IsEditable Dropdown width bug
body: When ComboBox IsEditable=true, dropdown width is set to textbox width. This means, when empty and set to auto-width, the dropdown width is very narrow and text for longer options are occluded. This behavior is different from ComboBox when IsEditable=false, where dropdown width is conveniently adjusting to the widest item. However, unlike winforms, ComboBox DropDownWidth property is not available for developers to fix it themselves. As a result, we have to change the ComboBox width itself or wait for the SDK fix.

comments.body: Additionally, if IsEditable=true then programmatically edited to IsEditable=false, the ComboBox becomes unusable
